definition: abbr. for Ukraine 烏克蘭|乌克兰[Wu1 ke4 lan2]/surname Wu
100 ml/one-tenth of a peck/measure for dry grain equal to one-tenth of sheng 升 or liter, or one-hundredth dou 斗
to close/to join/to fit/to be equal to/whole/together/round (in battle)/conjunction (astronomy)/1st note of pentatonic scale/old variant of 盒[he2]
abbr. for 眾議院|众议院[Zhong4 yi4 yuan4], House of Representatives

sentences.english: Use Mob Psychology to control the masses.
sentences.chinese: 使用乌合之众的心理学控制群众。

sentences.english: Meanwhile, the ragtag crew has nightmarish encounters with skitters and mechs.
sentences.chinese: 同时，乌合之众船员恶梦般的遭遇很快和机甲。

sentences.english: A Mob's a Monster; Heads enough, but no Brains.
sentences.chinese: 一群乌合之众就像一个怪物，头长得很多就是没脑筋。

sentences.english: The mob is running rampant, and they’ve infiltrated the police department.
sentences.chinese: 这些乌合之众迅速蔓延，很快便渗进警察部门。

sentences.english: This sucks. Now I have to adventure with a bunch of total skeezy losers.
sentences.chinese: 这下子，我得和这堆乌合之众一起冒险了。

sentences.english: if the rabble continues to be occupied with you, simply stop reading that drivel.
sentences.chinese: 如果这群乌合之众继续纠缠你，就别读那些废话。

sentences.english: The rebels are a ragtag force.
sentences.chinese: 利比亚反叛军是一群乌合之众组成的军事力量。

definition: lit. straggling and disbanded soldiers (idiom); fig. disorganized uncoordinated action
ruined army, defeated general (idiom); scattered remnants
loose and disorganized soldiers/stragglers/fig. a loner
to collapse on the first encounter/to give way at once
wine sack, food bag (idiom); useless person, only fit for guzzling and boozing
to flee in disorder/defeated and in rout
